It all started with a dream - Ed Sabol\'s dream to be exact -The dream of combining two life-long passions, football and movie making. In 1962, it became a reality and for over 40 years NFL Films has changed the way sports films are made and enjoyed. For the first time ever, NFL Films presents "Legends of Autumn" - A three-disc collection encompassing the early years of NFL Films. Hosted by Steve Sabol, "Legends of Autumn" tells the history of the company which went from a small group called Blair Motion Pictures to the present day "Keepers of the Flame" of the NFL. This three-disc set offers rare classics featuring the pulse-pounding music and classic sound which became the trademark of NFL Films. Bonus Features amd commentary by Steve Sabol provide the rich backstory behind the classic films. For over 40 years, NFL Films has created one NFL Legend after the next. Now, in "Legends of Autumn" you\'ll re-live the moments and savor the history of the greatest film-makers in sports. Bring home the magic of NFL Films today.'] Average Rating: 3.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Music Videos & Concerts, Sports', 'Format': 'Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Steve Sabol, NFL Films', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '8 hours and 13 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 2 inches; 10.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DV1515', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '8 hours and 13 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 30, 2007', 'Actors': 'NFL Films, Steve Sabol', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'NFL', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: barely plays in the blu ray dvd player.......... sad.. Review Title: waste of money Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/01/24 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Dominik'], 'Producers': ['Dede Gardner', 'Brad Pitt', 'Steve Schwartz', 'Paula Mae Schwartz', 'Anthony Katagas'], 'Starring': ['Brad Pitt', 'Sam Rockwell', 'Ray Liotta']} Review Text: dreary setting, boring people, aimless plot, not one likeable person in the whole movie Review Title: possibly the worst movie of all time Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user generally appreciates high-quality productions, as indicated by the consistently high average ratings of their purchases. Many interactions showcase favorable reactions to engaging storytelling and strong performances from established actors. The user seems to enjoy well-crafted films with solid direction and production values, expressing satisfaction with various genres, hinting at an overall preference for engaging and compelling narratives. Having rated multiple titles positively, it's clear that they are drawn to entertainment that offers depth and character development.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
The user expresses significant dissatisfaction with several purchases, particularly focusing on poorly executed films. Common criticisms include lackluster plots, weak casting decisions, and overly predictable storylines. They also mention instances of excessive foul language or content that detracts from the viewing experience. Frustration over products that do not meet expectations, such as DVDs that barely play, adds to their negative feedback, leading to low ratings for these items. The user appears quick to dismiss films they find unfulfilling or subpar in quality.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchasing history reflects a mixed experience with their choices in entertainment. While they often lean towards high ratings and appreciate strong storylines and performances, there are notable instances of disappointment with poorly executed films or formats that failed to function properly. The user’s feedback suggests a desire for authenticity and quality in storytelling, which informs their positive ratings, juxtaposed against their negative reactions to films that do not deliver an engaging or enjoyable experience.
